definitions.definition: To have (something) as a component or a related part ; to comprise , to include .
examples: My job involves forecasting economic trends.

subdefinitions.definition: To include (something) as a logical or natural , or necessary component, or consequence or effect of something else; to entail , to imply .

definitions.definition: To cause or engage (someone or something) to become connected or implicated , or to participate , in some activity or situation .
examples: By involving herself in her local community, Mary met lots of people and also helped make it a nicer place to live.
How can we involve the audience more during the show?
I don’t want to involve him in my personal affairs.
We are always trying to involve new technology in our products.

subdefinitions.definition: Chiefly followed by with : to engage (someone or oneself) in an emotional or sexual relationship .
subdefinitions.label_groups: specifically , also reflexive , chiefly passive voice

definitions.definition: To entangle , intertwine , or mingle (something with one or more other things , or several things together); especially, to entangle (someone or something) in a confusing or troublesome situation.
examples: to involve a person in debt or misery

subdefinitions.definition: To cover or envelop (something) completely ; to hide , to surround .
examples: to involve in darkness or obscurity

subdefinitions.definition: To form (something) into a coil or spiral , or into folds ; to entwine , to fold up , to roll , to wind round .
To multiply (a number ) by itself a given number of times ; to raise to any assigned power .
examples: a quantity involved to the third or fourth power

main_definition: To have (something) as a component or a related part ; to comprise , to include .
secondary_definitions: To cause or engage (someone or something) to become connected or implicated , or to participate , in some activity or situation .

( figuratively ) To entangle , intertwine , or mingle (something with one or more other things , or several things together); especially, to entangle (someone or something) in a confusing or troublesome situation.
